Sentencas: Catalytic steam reforming of natural gas is an attractive method of producing the hydrogen required by the present generation of fuel cells.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells

Sentencas: The molten carbonate (MCFC) and solid oxide (SOFC) fuel cells operate at high enough temperatures for the endothermic steam reforming reaction to be carried out within the stack.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells

Sentencas: For the MCFC, the conventional anodes have insufficient activity to catalyse the steam reforming of natural gas.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells

Sentencas: For these cells, internal reforming can be achieved only with the addition of a separate catalyst, preferably located in close proximity to the anode.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells

Sentencas: However, in the so-called 'Direct Internal Reforming' configuration, attack from alkali in the MCFC may severely limit catalyst lifetime.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells

Sentencas: In the case of the state-of-the-art SOFC, natural gas can be reformed directly on the nickel cermet anode.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells

Sentencas: However, in the SOFC, temperature variations in the cell caused by the reforming reaction may limit the amount of internal reforming that can be allowed in practice.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, some external pre-reforming may be desirable to remove high molecular weight hydrocarbons from the fuel gas, which would otherwise crack to produce elemental carbon.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells

Sentencas: Degradation of the SOFC anode may also be a problem when internal reforming is carried out.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells

Sentencas: This has prompted several research groups to investigate the use of alternative anode materials.
Titulo: Advances in catalysts for internal reforming in high temperature fuel cells
